page.name: Celebrate Short-Term Goals
page.content:
Educators should draw learners' attention to the goals of each lesson. As AE teachers it is important to remember to align goals with "proximal challenges." This means goals should be set close to the learning event. For example, if the goal of a lesson is to learn how to add fractions, examples of proximal challenges might be to "identify the denominator and numerator in a fraction" and "determine if the denominators of two fractions are the same." Once this goal is accomplished, educators should take the time to stop and celebrate with the learners. Doing this will model for learners how to set short-term goals and will build self-esteem which increases persistence towards longer goals (Hott, et al., 2012). 

Pro Tip: Celebrate the accomplishment of small goals.

Try it Yourself: Set goals with your adult learners
